newsitem.title: UK: N.Sea crude markets firm as Ekofisks snapped up.
newsitem.headline: N.Sea crude markets firm as Ekofisks snapped up.

text.p: North Sea crude markets firmed on Tuesday as a clutch of Ekofisks changed hands at strong premiums and transatlantic buying looked set to support the physical Brent market into late February, traders said.
Four Ekofisk cargoes, loading in the second and third decades of February, traded at premiums to Dated Brent of between 30 and 34 cents.
A Statfjord loading Feb 21-23 fetched a firm Dated Brent +50 cents, while a Draugen loading 23-25 was sold at Dated +48 cents, four cents up on its last traded level.
Two third decade Forties were also believed traded on a p+c basis at Dated Brent +40/45 cents.
Narrowing refining margins have so far failed to dampen the crude market's strength, dealers said.
"I'm just a little surprised at the firmness at which these barrels are moving," said one.
Underscoring the market's bullish tone, the two Brent dates nominated from the paper chains on Tuesday were kept ahead of the five o-clock deadline.

A U.S. refiner confirmed that it had bought an end-Feb loading Brent cargo into the Gulf Coast at around March WTI -40 cents for March 10-15 delivery. Two other refiners were also heard to have picked up cargoes.
"That's a bullish sign, because if anything (the third decade) was the top heavy end of the month," a trader said.
"It indicates to me that there is going to be a tight Brent market to keep premiums up," he added.
On the Brent paper market, intermonth spreads edged higher from earlier discussion. Feb/Mar was valued at +42/46 cents and Mar/Apr traded at +41 and +42.
